author: Alvin Bayle
comment: Not a bad app. Sometimes I want to enjoy watching Netflix or Hulu without getting up. It's also pretty good with Spotify since non premium membership using skip on the Spotify app to control the Spotify on my PC is limited.   However on my Huawei Honor 6. I have to move the mouse pointer slow otherwise the mouse pointer doesn't register my swipes.

author: Lucas Rumney
comment: I've always wanted a TV remote for my PC with flashing animated ads that loses connection if more than thirty seconds passes. Lovely minimalist app with fifty menus and wonderfully designed interfaces that make controlling my computer like raking nails down a chalkboard. I'm concerned that your marketspace might be edged out by the fifty foot USB cable, or one of the hundreds of identical apps on the app store. You should make a remote app for every device in my house! Now all I have to do is press 5 small targets on screen, and pray to cthulu, and I can control my toaster. Or is the toaster roaster controller going to be in the paid version of your next app?

author: Siro Guitar
comment: This app works, but when I want to scroll, it pinch zooms, even when I've turned it off.   Edit: I found a scroll wheel function, but using the 2 finger scroll method would be easier if it didn't think I was pinching to zoom in or out (bare in mind that I turned off the pinch to zoom option in the mouse settings).  A suggestion I would make is a forward or back button for web browsing. Having to use my mouse to click back can become repetitive, especially when you're sitting quite far from the screen; it is a pretty small icon.

author: Rahul Gurav
comment: Best available in my search. Easy interface. Not smooth mouse movement as compare to others but it doesn't mean you can't control it. Other smoothness giving apps hangs after some time and we have to wait for it to reconnect. But this app is not hanging this is big plus.

author: Anthony Sabatini
comment: Asks every time I open it if I want to upgrade which is annoying. On top of that there are intrusive ads on the mouse control screen. So if I'm on the couch trying to control my PC, it will suddenly stop working and I look down at the phone, there is a full size ad covering the screen. No thanks.

author: James Wood
comment: Remote Desktop (Chrome)  allows full access and mirroring free, no ads!  Drawback; process to get set up, and only one can access at a time.

author: Dale Hiltner
comment: There are better apps out there that work. I don't like how you have to turn on and off double click. Also several features are turned off unless you purchase this app. You can get those same features in free apps that work better.

author: TheSharpenedPen
comment: Does not work on my device. It says it's connected but nothing typed appears on screen. May be a problem with my Alcatrel phone?

author: EliseandElijah Hiltner
comment: It is inferior to other remote apps. There is a delay to double click and select certain things. UI needs to be easier and more free flowing with less touches. Too many things are blocked out in the free version as well. There are fully free remote apps out there that are full functioning.

author: Lissa Blackthorne
comment: This is a trial version, I get it, but it's so feature limited it's impossible to see how the full version will work without buying it first. For example, I need to be able to send multiple languages to my computer and use the extended keyboard. Those are not well supported in the galaxy of remote keyboard apps, and this one disables them outright in the trial version. Please add a feature lets me enable the full version for a day once a month or something so that users can get a fair feel of how it works.

author: Shane Caudle
comment: I stream movies from my laptop to my TV. I don't want my laptop on the couch with me so I leave it  out of reach. I used my wireless mouse for a while but that's a pain to use on the couch. This app is the almost perfect solution. Why almost? Everyone is different try it for yourself.

author: Brad Maggard
comment: Been using it for a couple years for when I want to watch Netflix on my computer but stay in bed and I've never had an issue. The basic input is fantastic and I've never experienced any latency when controlling my PC.

author: Ronald Shonge
comment: My TV sensor is messed up.. Thanks guys for this application I don't need to stand up and I can browse the files on my computer and play or read to the TV display. . Well done guys. . You have my support

author: Chris Black
comment: This is exactly what I was looking for. I watch movies on my PC on the 4k monitor, but have always carried my wifi keyboard to the couch for media controls. Even the mouse control with this is super smooth and accurate.

author: JAKEJ GG
comment: Considering I've got the free version I use the media remote for films and stuff. I was pleasantly surprised with how little delay there is. Its as if your using a remote for the TV but better. Genuinely use full and I will be buying the full app !!

author: Kendrick Britto
comment: Very convenient. A few glitches here and there but not any you cannot live without .. a must have app

author: Brad Davis
comment: Immediately asked for money on the first button I pressed. Even basic functions you have to be upgraded for...

author: Rogue Girl
comment: It does exactly what I need it to do. There are some ads buy not any annoying ones. Great if you don't have ir on your phone. 5*
Stop working randomly with MPC HC and android app freeze making screen flash until killed. Could be a very good app if these problem does not occur

author: ciaranoc
comment: Worked fine till latest update which now stalls on syncing remotes, even with full paid version, which is now useless. Uninstalled, reinstalled, still would not sync and new version has ads, despite paying for the thing. Meh...

author: Phenicia K.
comment: i love this app! the best one for me so far 😃 so easy to use and comes in handy when i need to work quietly at night 😃 i can type things using this remote keyboard and it doesn't bother anyone with the tactactac! sound at all cuz i don't have to hit the physical keys on my laptop. thank you so much for developing this creative invention! 💖

Worked just as good as it was described except for the little wake on lan function. Other than that minor detail, everything about is perfect for what I need. Will be purchasing the full version very soon. :)

author: Derek Fujimoto
comment: Ubuntu has the mouse vanish after a while, or while watching something in full screen, and the unified remote control does not trigger the mouse reappearance. Otherwise an excellent app.

author: peterjordan1977
comment: Well actually it works but I don't want apps asking me to give them 5 stars I'll make my own mind up about how I rate apps thanks and also the advert for premium is annoying we know it's limited and I will be buying it one day but didn't need to have it rammed up my nose twenty times a minute

author: Chet Jonstun
comment: It started off fine. Quick connect. Did what it should. Then kept failing to connect. Uninstalled. Reinstalled. Worked. Failed. Failed. And kept on asking for beer!  Finally deleted it for good.

author: Ron Anderson
comment: I gave it 5 stars. The only thing that I wish it had is a way to use my headphones. But I still love it.

author: Matt Kollman
comment: The app itself seems great, but you have to be extremely careful. While using the power options, I somehow managed to hit the sleep button multiple times, still not sure what happened. It ended up putting my PC into an endless loop. This wouldn't have been a huge deal if windows hadn't made it so you can't boot into safe mode without shutting your computer down in a special way or windows failing 4 times in a row. My biggest concern is that they know this is a problem because there's a guide on their website as to what your supposed to do to fix it, but they haven't made it so you can't hit the button multiple times in a row. I'm really glad they had the guide otherwise it probably would've taken me 4 times longer to fix it, but it's not that hard to at the very least add a delay to the button or something.

author: shawn tane
comment: Wanted to replace gmote I used on old windows 7 laptop & this app did a great job(just installed few hours before bed & it worked with no issues)wish there was remote for my Xbox, might buy full version after a few weeks of I'm still enjoying & its working.Ability to play media from computer is bonus too(wonder if I can work chromecast things top from phone using?)

author: Josh
comment: I like the app it comes in handy all the time on PCs hooked up to my  TV's, it makes  Controlling the Pcs from my couch pretty easy. I wish they would add control over Android devices like Android TV and other set top boxes based on Android. That would make this the ultimate remote control app.

author: Mark Eltringham
comment: Rubbish. Won't sync. Why should it? Previous remote apps have worked perfectly

author: Clinton Halston
comment: This is making me much more productive at work while my broken collarbone heals. It works great!

author: Shuhanul Islam
comment: OMG this app is true innovation. Flawlessly controlling my pc in my home network from my bed couple if feet away which I have tested so far. I don't even need to buy a seperate remote, this free app is enough to do what I was looking for. I will try more of the app and if I like it a lot I will buy the premium version.

author: Alexandre Fina
comment: fantastic! just be lazy now!

author: Ryan Price
comment: The app is great! The only reason it's 4 and not 5 is because the Bluetooth doesn't always connect right. That night not be the apps fault though. The Wi-Fi option works almost every time though and its very easy to use

author: Shadman Shahriar
comment: I use an AMOLED display which poses the chances of the screen having burn-ins while I use the trackpad constantly. I would appreciate it if the trackpad display were to be completely black with texts that move at certain time intervals. My point is to make this software AMOLED and OLED friendly. Thank you.

author: Emma Titova
comment: Issues with leftclick and hold. It doesnt unpress the button so it is kept hold even when you remove finger from phone. This caused me to max my speakers by accident. Causing pain in my ears.

author: Jarrod Fues
comment: Great for entertainment pc in the living room. I don't think I would install it on a system with sensitive information though.

author: Gábor Miklós Molnár
comment: Very useful for the lazy dictators like me.  Now I can easily cut the PC time for the kiddo.😁

author: Alessandro Mammana
comment: the features of the free version include a pointer and a keyboard, which I can use to manage my raspberry pi with my phone from the couch. works flawlessly. I cannot type control keys such as ESC and TAB without upgrading, but I guess thats fair.

author: Monroe Walker
comment: Has ads, pushes a little to upgrade, but allows volume control, mouse and keyboard input and I'm sure a bunch of other features for free
